item.description: For Whom the Bell Tolls by Ernest Hemmingway. Review I really enjoyed it. Hemmingway is a talented writer, especially for the male reader.

item.title: Against Supremacy
item.description: Against Supremacy Imagine there’s a white interest group, to mirror the black and latino interest groups that many companies and organizations have.

item.title: American Elites
item.description: Every society has elites, because human beings vary widely in their talents, abilities, and attitudes. Elites are simply those that are on the top.

item.title: Booting Argument
item.description: So, I browsed through a fiery debate that raged through provopulse a year or so back about the legitimacy of booting to enforce parking regulations, and wanted to bring it up again to see if we could generate some useful ideas on whether it is or is not ethical, and if it is not, what some alternatives might be.

item.title: Internal Hypocrites
item.description: We come into self-awareness when we first perceive someone perceiving us. And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men.

item.title: Judicial Interpration for Cynics
item.description: Judicial Interpretation for Cynics The Truth The truth of the matter is that there is no such thing as democracy. At least as it’s popularly conceived, of people voting to elect representatives to pass laws, and everyone agreeing to be bound by those laws.

item.title: Sanewashing
item.description: Occurs in a polarized political environment. Extremist propose a crazy position. The other side reacts to that crazy position. Moderates on the extremist side aren’t paying attention to their own extremists, but see the other side’s reaction and, convinced that it must be wrong,

item.title: Using This Site
item.description: Info on the digital garden concept. Site Directory All Notes Technical Details My notes are written in [markdown]( Markdown Guide), a simple plaintext way to add basic formatting like itallics and bold without trapping your writing in a proprietary, cumbersome format like Microsoft’s docx, or in something uneditable like PDF.
